text: this is a leatherback turtle looking for
lunch and this is the turtle having
lunch over and over again each summer
leatherback turtles migrate from as far
as South America to the waters off Nova
Scotia all for this gelatinous feast to
learn more about their behavior in these
cold Canadian waters scientists tick
cameras on their backs with suction cups
they found that the turtles make shorter
and shallower dives than in southern
waters they also catch a lot of their
prey on the way up they may silhouette
the jellyfish against the Sun knowing
more about their behavior may help
protect these endangered animals from
getting caught up in fishing
they clearly don't need any help in
finding lunch
all
